front.title: On the difficulty of Quantum Cryptography in presence of packet losses

abstract.t: From the communication viewpoint, qubits are different from classical bits. A qubit may be transmitted directly but it can’t be cloned or measured without altering its state, so existing copy-and-resend schemes can’t be used to handle a transmission failure. Moreover, in some cases, the sender does not know the state of the transmitted qubit, so a qubit loss may cause irrevocable damage. This draft presents the causes of transmission failures, and analyses the vulnerabilities of several crypto protocols that such defects may bring forth. Thus, quantum teleportation is highly recommended for certain applications.
